report.title: Riding that train
report.author: Murple
report.bodytext: This was far from my first time using cocaine... I'd had it perhaps 2 dozen times since 1990... but this time I decided to try and document the effects as they occured. /n /n Nov. 23, 1997 /n ------------- /n /n 11:27pm: /n I just cut out two medium-to-small sized lines of cocaine. I've /n already had about 6 or 7 lines over the past 3 hours or so, the last /n being a little over an hour ago. I smoked a bowl of pot about 45 minutes /n ago, but its effects are pretty much unnoticeable, except maybe a slight /n reduction in the edginess of the cocaine effects. I'm definately still /n feeling the effects, although I'm in the come-down stage at present. The /n next 2 lines should give me a pretty typical high-dose cocaine experience. /n At present, I feel contradictorally wired and tired. I feel as if I could /n fall asleep if I wanted, although from experience I know I couldn't yet. I /n feel a warm fuzzy feeling all over my body, similar to the feeling of the /n second wind you get when you stay up all night, but there is also a mild /n feeling of stimulant tension. Euphoria has definately long since passed. /n Cocaine makes me dehydrated, and this manifests itself primarily in the /n feeling of dry mouth. I will frequently suck on my cheeks, trying to /n salivate, I guess. It's not really a conscious thing. Its a bad thing, /n actually, as it makes the dry mouth worse, and sometimes will leave my /n mouth feeling uncomfortable the next day. I'm going to finish my /n cigarette, then do these lines. /n /n 11:33pm: /n I snort the lines, and immediately feel both euphoria, and a /n passing urge to get the rest of my coke out and do more. I get the urge to /n smoke a cigarette, so I do. The high intensifies for a minute or two then /n levels. I'm mildly euphoric, but very stimulated. Its a distinct /n stimulation, more like amphetamines than caffeine. But definately /n different. There is a mild anesthetic property, mainly concentrated in my /n mouth and nose, and a generalized tingly, warm sensation. I notice myself /n typing alot harder, but pausing more between sentences. The urge to smoke /n my cigarette is overwhelming. There is a warm feeling along my spine. /n Mentally, I feel both calm and stimulated, somewhat paradoxically. If /n there were people here, I'd be talkative. /n /n 11:38pm: /n I am feeling a barely perceptible decrease in the high, and decide /n to stop typing for a little bit to enjoy it, probably with another /n cigarette. The urge to do more coke occasionally pops into my mind but /n then leaves just as quickly. /n /n 11:53pm: /n I went and smoked a cigarette, and alternated (quite frequently) /n between walking around my room smoking it, sitting on the edge of my bed, /n and putting down the cigarette to lay down and close my eyes. Laying down, /n I felt very calm, and as if my body were floating. The peak wore off /n gradually, and not evenly. I would alternate between feeling come-down /n effects and peak effects, with the come-down periods becoming longer and /n more frequent. /n /n The euphoria is mostly gone now, and the thoughts of doing more /n coke are a little more frequent and longer, but are nowhere near /n irresistable. Simply being aware of the craving seems to make it go away. /n I took a multivitamin just now, which I always do before bed anytime I do /n any drugs outside of my usual ones (pot, tobacco, and caffeine). It /n generally reduces day-after fatigue. The stimulation is still quite /n strong, and more amphetamine-like, although it is beginning to fade into /n the post-peak mellowness of cocaine. I am almost back to the point I was /n when I began writing this. /n /n Physically, the dry-mouth has become more noticable again. My /n lungs feel sort of grimy from smoking too many cigarettes (cocaine tends /n to make me chain smoke), and my nasal passages feel somewhat clogged and /n sore from doing coke all night. I snorted a few drops of warm water to /n help clear out my nose, which helped significantly. I can still /n occasionally taste cocaine in the back of my throat if I snort or breath /n deeply through my nose. /n /n 12:05am: /n I'm basically back to where I was at the beginning now. I feel /n calm and quiet. I don't really feel bad, although there have been times /n when I've felt quite depressed and physically worn when I've done alot of /n cocaine in a short time. I feel physically worn out, and mentally a little /n tired, but its definately not a bad thing - basically like being /n overtired, despite the fact that I know I could not fall asleep right now. /n I've probably done about 1/2 gram over the course of about 4 hours, which /n although is alot, is nowhere near the most I've done; that would probably /n be about 1.5 grams over 2 or 3 hours. Aside from the two lines I did while /n writing this, I used the cocaine in a social setting tonight, with a girl /n and a guy I'm friends with. Its when doing it alone that I'll sit there /n and do line after line until it's gone or I just can't take anymore. /n /n I plan on smoking a small bowl of pot to relax, and write a little /n more. I'm going to take a 3mg melatonin tablet and probably a shot of /n tequila before I go to bed, to counteract the stimulant effect that would /n keep me from sleeping. I'll still probably be unable to sleep for about an /n hour, perhaps more, but it will definately help, though it will probably /n make me groggier tomorrow. /n /n Overall, it was an enjoyable experience, but not outstandingly so. /n Cocaine simply isn't my drug of choice. I'm glad I did it, but it'll /n probably be a while before I do it again. /n /n 12:16am: /n I take my melatonin, and take a hit off my bowl. This experiment /n is at an end.
